check local machine for sshd running "su: if your local machine is behind a router: have you set portforwarding (WAN 22 -> your local machine 22)?
no ssh (LISTEN), "sudo apt-get install openssh-server && sudo service ssh start" after you configured portforwarding
but when im connected to a network i have to go to the admin for porforwarding ?
portforwarding is only needed if you're NATed. if your local-IP is accessible from WAN you don't need it.
how do i find out about it ? ;)
"sudo apt-get install openssh-server && sudo service ssh start" and then try to connect from your server again. if it works, you're not NATed ;)

use your IP adress or a dyndns service
